short_description: Layered eggplant, spiced lamb, and bechamel casserole.
steps: Salt and fry eggplant.
Make meat sauce.
Layer.
Top with bechamel.
Bake.
cooking_tips: Salt eggplant.
Rest before cutting.
nutrition_benefits: Protein from lamb, fiber from eggplant.

short_description: Grilled pork skewers with oregano, lemon, and tzatziki.
steps: Marinate pork.
Skewer.
Grill.
Serve with pita.
cooking_tips: Room temp meat.
Hot grill.

short_description: Flaky phyllo pie with spinach and feta cheese.
steps: Cook spinach.
Mix with feta.
Layer phyllo.
Bake.
cooking_tips: Squeeze spinach dry.
Brush phyllo well.
nutrition_benefits: Iron from spinach, calcium from feta.

short_description: Cool yogurt dip with cucumber, garlic, and dill.
steps: Grate and drain cucumber.
Mix with yogurt.
Add garlic and dill.
cooking_tips: Drain cucumber well.
Rest for flavor.

short_description: Fresh tomatoes, cucumber, olives, and feta with oregano.
steps: Chop vegetables.
Add feta.
Dress with olive oil.
cooking_tips: Ripe tomatoes.
Quality olive oil.
nutrition_benefits: Healthy fats from olives and olive oil, calcium from feta.

short_description: Layered phyllo pastry with nuts and honey syrup.
steps: Layer phyllo and nuts.
Cut.
Bake.
Pour hot syrup.
cooking_tips: Cold syrup on hot baklava.
Sharp knife.
nutrition_benefits: Healthy fats from nuts, antioxidants from honey.

short_description: Greek baked pasta with layers of tubular pasta, spiced meat sauce, and creamy bechamel. Often called Greek lasagna, this comfort food classic is a staple at family gatherings.
steps: Cook pasta until al dente, drain and toss with a little butter.
Brown ground beef with onion, add tomato sauce and cinnamon.
Make bechamel: melt butter, add flour, cook 2 minutes.
Gradually whisk in warm milk until thick and smooth.
Add nutmeg and half the cheese, let cool slightly, then whisk in eggs.
Mix half the pasta with the meat sauce.
Layer plain pasta on the bottom of a buttered baking dish.
Add meat and pasta layer on top.
Pour bechamel over everything and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 45-50 minutes until golden brown.
cooking_tips: Let the pastitsio rest 15 minutes before cutting for cleaner slices.
The bechamel should be thick enough to coat a spoon.
Kefalotiri can be substituted with pecorino romano.
nutrition_benefits: Pastitsio provides complete protein from beef and dairy. The dish offers calcium from cheese and milk. Cinnamon may help regulate blood sugar.

short_description: Tender grape leaves stuffed with herbed rice, pine nuts, and fresh dill, served with lemon. These bite-sized parcels are a beloved mezze that showcase Greek hospitality.
steps: Rinse grape leaves and blanch in boiling water for 2 minutes.
Saute finely chopped onions in olive oil until soft.
Add rice, pine nuts, herbs, salt, and pepper to onions.
Add 1/2 cup water and cook partially for 10 minutes.
Place a tablespoon of filling on each grape leaf and roll tightly.
Line a pot with extra grape leaves.
Arrange dolmades seam-side down in tight layers.
Add water to cover, lemon juice, and remaining olive oil.
Place a plate on top to prevent unrolling.
Simmer on low for 45 minutes. Serve at room temperature.
cooking_tips: Use the vein side of the leaf facing up when rolling.
Don't roll too tightly - rice needs room to expand.
These are best made a day ahead for flavors to develop.
nutrition_benefits: Dolmades are rich in antioxidants from grape leaves. Olive oil provides heart-healthy fats. The herbs add vitamins and digestive benefits.

short_description: Seasoned meat stacked and roasted on a vertical spit, shaved thin and wrapped in warm pita with tzatziki, tomatoes, and onions. This iconic Greek street food is loved worldwide.
steps: Slice meat into thin strips.
Mix yogurt, garlic, oregano, paprika, olive oil, and lemon juice.
Marinate meat in mixture for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight.
Stack marinated meat on skewers or cook in a hot pan.
Cook until charred on edges and cooked through.
Slice tomatoes and red onion.
Warm pita bread on a grill or pan.
Spread tzatziki on pita, add meat, vegetables, and wrap.
Serve immediately with extra tzatziki on the side.
cooking_tips: High heat is essential for the characteristic crispy edges.
Let meat rest briefly before slicing.
Authentic gyros use a vertical rotisserie, but home methods work well.
nutrition_benefits: Gyros provides high-quality protein from meat. Tzatziki adds probiotics and calcium. The dish offers B vitamins and iron.

short_description: Crispy phyllo pastry filled with creamy semolina custard and soaked in lemon-scented syrup. This beloved Greek dessert offers the perfect contrast of textures.
steps: Heat milk with half the sugar until simmering.
Gradually whisk in semolina, stirring until thick.
Remove from heat, add butter, vanilla, and lemon zest.
Beat eggs and fold into cooled custard.
Make syrup by boiling remaining sugar with water and honey.
Layer half the phyllo sheets in a buttered pan, brushing each with melted butter.
Pour custard over phyllo layers.
Top with remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter.
Score top layers into portions and bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
Pour cold syrup over hot galaktoboureko immediately.
cooking_tips: The custard should be warm, not hot, when adding eggs.
Score only the top layers before baking for easier cutting.
Cold syrup on hot pastry is essential for proper absorption.
nutrition_benefits: Galaktoboureko provides calcium from milk. Eggs add protein and B vitamins. The dessert offers quick energy from carbohydrates.
